cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: moving west then west-northwest, expected to pass over the northern Leeward Islands tonight and continue toward the Bahamas, Cuba and Florida peninsula through day-5

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches extend from Guadeloupe, Dominican Republic, Haiti, Turks & Caicos and the SE Bahamas (well south of Georgia).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings in the northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico (well south of Georgia).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands tonight, then Puerto Rico, Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, the Bahamas, Cuba and possibly Florida during the 5-day period.
weather_observation.wind: Only a 6 % cumulative chance of 34-kt (gale) winds reaching the Georgia coast late in the 5-day period; near-term wind threat is minimal.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None indicated for Georgia within the current 5-day forecast window.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall is confined to the Caribbean islands under warning; significant rain not expected for coastal Georgia within 5 days.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells from Irma may begin to reach the Southeast U.S. coast late in the period, causing dangerous surf and rip currents.
